replies.body:
If the server decisions that 90% of the community disagrees with keep happening, then Avicus will be dead in the next couple months. I think that most of the regulars that have been here as long as most of us are on the last straw with the server updates, especially more recently. There's polls that ask the community what they want, then that poll gets thrown out and the update still happens, most of the time going against what the vote of the poll was. The most recent topic I can think of is the poll about updating to 1.9+. Thankfully this was listened to, but if you read through the whole post, you can clearly tell that the point of the post wasn't mainly to get an opinion, it was made as a "hey we are doing this at some point, so we are going to make this seem like an option, but we don't really care what you think".
I'm not totally sure that this makes sense, but I think I got the point across.

I think Avicus will survive for a while if the community starts to get a say in what happens. The community is fed up with being told they are getting what they want then not getting it, and at this point if that doesn't stop soon a lot of people are going to leave. Avicus' community is very strong and pretty much everyone knows everyone, but just because we aren't on Avicus doesn't mean that won't survive. Stratus has a bigger, and if we're being real, better server. The only thing Avicus has over Stratus right now is the community, and a lot of Avicus is starting to play on Stratus and playing less on Avicus. It's not hard for a whole community to switch servers and still survive, especially one as small as Avicus'. I think the people in charge of decisions need to realize that and base updates off the community, not development.

replies.body:
I feel like Avicus won't die any time soon, the playercount just bounces up and down a bit, like it's done for ages now.
Like mentioned above, I think Avicus will not die until the ones hosting the server lose interest.
People always say a server is dying when the old players leave, but this is far from true.
Servers grow by getting new players, not by keeping older ones. Ofcourse keeping players is great, but not needed...
Take any server, Hypixel for example, I bet you almost all old players aren't playing anymore, yet they're still growing.
Another example is Mineplex: they are barely getting new players, the current players are mostly ones that have stayed with them for ages. This may be why their playercount dropped this much?


Conclusion:
I don't think Avicus is going to die soon, they just need to get new players interested and (sorry) stop focussing just on the older ones.
